Uses of Class
battle.Target

    • Uses of Target in battle

      Fields in battle declared as Target 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Target Target.ANY_ALLY
      Allied fighters on the battlefield, including the fighter with the targeting skill.
      static Target Target.ANY_ENEMY
      Enemy fighters on the battlefield.
      static Target Target.ANY_OTHER_ALLY
      Allied fighters on the battlefield, excluding the fighter with the targeting skill.
      static Target Target.ANYONE
      Any fighter on the battlefield.
      static Target Target.ANYONE_ELSE
      Any fighter on the battlefield, except for the fighter with the targeting skill.
      static Target Target.CLOSE_ALLY
      Allied fighters close to the fighter with the targeting skill that includes the fighter with the targeting skill.
      static Target Target.CLOSE_ENEMY
      Enemy fighters close to the fighter with the targeting skill.
      static Target Target.OTHER_CLOSE_ALLY
      Allied fighters close to the fighter with the targeting skill that excludes the fighter with the targeting skill.
      static Target Target.SELF
      The fighter with the targeting skill.
      private Target SkillBuilder.target
      Stores the target value for producing a Skill object.
      private Target Skill.target 
      Methods in battle that return Target 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Target Target.getCostumTarget(java.util.function.BiFunction<Battlefield,Fighter,java.util.List<Fighter>> function)
      Instantiates and returns a Target object using the given function for returning a list of targets from the fighters on a battlefield.
      Target Skill.getTarget() 
      Methods in battle with parameters of type Target 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SkillBuilder SkillBuilder.setTarget(Target target)
      Sets the enumerated target value for determining valid Fighter objects this skill applies its effects to.
      Constructors in battle with parameters of type Target 
      Constructor and Description
      Skill(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, Target target, int maxTargets, java.time.Duration cooldown, java.util.function.Predicate<Skill> useCase, boolean stunBreak, boolean deathless, java.util.List<Status> effects, java.util.List<java.lang.String> requirements, java.util.List<Skill> subSkills, java.util.List<SkillHandler> listeners)
      Initializes the object so that all internal field variables that can be explicitly set are done so through the given parameters.
